intro: Satureja spinosa, commonly known as Spanish thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple and form in compact clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Satureja spinosa is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its aromatic and medicinal properties.
